title: Hendrickson, Rays avoid arbitration
subtitle: Hendrickson, Rays avoid arbitration
body: ST. PETERSBURG -- Tampa Bay pitcher Mark Hendrickson agreed to a one-year, $1.95 million contract on Monday, avoiding arbitration. Hendrickson, who led the club in wins a year ago, got the win in seven of his last eight decisions to finish 11-8 with a 5.90 ERA in 2005. The 6-foot-9 Hendrickson, a former NBA player, has a 21-23 record in two seasons with the Rays. Thomas Simonetti is a contributor to MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Thomas Simonetti
